recipe.title: Black Bean Empanadas

inspiration.text: Black Bean Empanadas - One Green Planet

recipe.ingredients: 1 cup all-purpose flour 1 cup wholewheat flour ¼ cup semolina flour 2 tbsp raw sugar 1 tsp sea salt ½ tsp baking powder 5 tbsp butter, cold ½ cup cold water 2 tsp apple cider vinegar
Black beans Refried black beans Red bell pepper, diced Onion, diced Fresh cilantro Lime juice Spanish spice blend
Fresh diced tomatoes Diced white onion Sea salt Lime juice

method.step: Make the filling: Sauté onion, red pepper, and spices with the whole black beans.
Mix in the refried beans. Warm and then remove from heat. Add lime juice to taste.

Make the dough and bake the empanadas: Mix the first six ingredients together in a large bowl. Then add butter. Break up into small pieces by hand. When fully dispersed, the dough is ready for the water/vinegar solution. Mix this until you have a shaggy dough; it might require more water.
When it sticks together, turn it out onto a floured board and roll into a 5x8-inch rectangle. Pop it back into the refrigerator at this time for an hour or so. This is an important step.
When ready to make the empanadas, pull out of the fridge and roll it out a bit more to 9x12-inch.
Cut it into 12 equal portions. Roll each square again to a 6x6-inch piece. These are your diamonds.
Fill one with a tablespoon or two of filling. Arrange so a corner is facing you and flip one side over to form a triangle. Crimp the edges with your fingers or a fork.
When they're all assembled, arrange on a lightly sprayed baking sheet and bake at 200°C for 25-30 minutes until golden brown.
Make the Pico De Gallo: Mix together the diced tomatoes, white onion, lime juice, and sea salt
